lines.text: Edit text in a PDF
Open the PDF you want to edit in Acrobat, and then select Edit in the global bar.

spans.text: Open the PDF you want to edit in Acrobat, and then select

lines.text: The PDF switches to the edit mode, and the Edit panel displays. If the PDF is generated from a

spans.text: The PDF switches to the edit mode, and the Edit panel displays. If the PDF is generated from a

lines.text: scanned document, Acrobat automatically runs OCR to make the text and images editable.

spans.text: scanned document, Acrobat automatically runs OCR to make the text and images editable.

lines.text: The Edit panel includes options to modify the page, add content, redact a PDF, and convert

spans.text: The Edit panel includes options to modify the page, add content, redact a PDF, and convert

lines.text: various documents to PDF forms. You can use the options in the Edit panel to replace, edit, or

spans.text: various documents to PDF forms. You can use the options in the Edit panel to replace, edit, or

spans.text: add text to a PDF. You can correct typos, change fonts and typeface size, adjust alignment,

lines.text: add superscripts or subscripts, and resize text or paragraphs.

spans.text: add superscripts or subscripts, and resize text or paragraphs.

lines.text: About editing text and images
Adobe Acrobat provides powerful tools and capabilities for editing PDF images and text.

spans.text: Adobe Acrobat provides powerful tools and capabilities for editing PDF images and text.

lines.text: You might encounter formatting challenges that require manual adjustments. Acrobat's

spans.text: You might encounter formatting challenges that require manual adjustments. Acrobat's

lines.text: image-editing capabilities are limited, and using high-resolution images can lead to

spans.text: image-editing capabilities are limited, and using high-resolution images can lead to

lines.text: performance issues due to larger file sizes. To address this, improve images using other tools

spans.text: performance issues due to larger file sizes. To address this, improve images using other tools

lines.text: before adding them to PDF documents.

spans.text: before adding them to PDF documents.

lines.text: If the original font isn't available, font substitutions may occur, altering the text's appearance.

spans.text: If the original font isn't available, font substitutions may occur, altering the text's appearance.

lines.text: To maintain consistency across devices, we suggest you use the available fonts or embed

spans.text: To maintain consistency across devices, we suggest you use the available fonts or embed

lines.text: them within the PDF.
You can also enhance document accessibility using Acrobat's features, such as adding

spans.text: You can also enhance document accessibility using Acrobat's features, such as adding

lines.text: alternative text for images and proper content tagging.

spans.text: alternative text for images and proper content tagging.
